tns:item.tns:title: Russley Rd - Memorial - Footpath Works
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Earthworks are to be conducted to remove land fill beneath the footpath and shoulder on Memorial Ave between Peter Leeming Dr and Russley Rd on the North side.
A shoulder closure & footpath closure will be in place, cyclist will be merged with vehicle traffic.
A pedestrian crossing will be established prior to the commencement of works to allow a crossing point for pedestrians during the works.
This method of TM was chosen as it would cause the least amount of disturbance to traffic.
The pedestrian crossing will be established during night work hours (1900 ? 0700)
Earthworks will be conducted during day work hours (0900 ? 1600)

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11166 Cashmere Rd WW Repairs
tns:item.tns:address: Cashmere Rd from #16 to Thorrington Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin outside #16 Cashmere Rd, and progress west towards the Thorrington Rd intersection. The replacement of the waste water main will be carried out under a contra flow with TSL during the day, and Thorrington Rd will be closed. (TMP 1a&1b) Once mainline works are completed, repair works will begin on the 4 laterals that cross Cashmere Rd. These laterals will be completed in two stages under stop/go at night. The first half of the laterals will be completed under an extension of the daytime closure, closing the east bound lane, with alternating traffic using the westbound lane. (TMP 2a&2b) The excavation on the northern kerb will then be backfilled and resurfaced, and the TTM closure will be reversed, with works moving towards the southern kerb, and the second half of the laterals will be completed, also under a stop/go at night. Works will involve investigation of the damaged sections of waste water main and laterals. Theses sections will then be excavated replaced, backfilled reinstated and resurfaced up to road level. Works are expected to take up to 6 weeks to complete

tns:item.tns:title: Fitzgerald Ave Resurfacing
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Fitzgerald Ave Northbound will be resurfaced from Cashel St to Chester St E over six night shifts.
At night the road will be reduced to one lane Northbound and a Stop/Go operation will be running. During the day the road will be fully open but the surface will be gravel for a time, followed by new seal with no road markings. A 30km/h temporary speed limit will be in place 24 hours for the duration.
Recommended alternative routes North are Madras St and Stanmore Rd.

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11217 Pages Rd Bridge Repair
tns:item.tns:address: 666 Pages Rd to New Brighton Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Day works Works will begin with investigations and crack repairs to the underside of the bridge, requiring a lane width reduction on either side of the bridge depending on the works. (TMP 2&3) Also during this time, the removal of the central island will be needed(TMP 1). Following that replacement of the handrails/wingwalls will take place under the same TM arrangement. The next stage of works will be the relocation of the service mains which area currently above ground on the southern footpath, and need to be moved to the underside of the bridge on the northern side. This will take place over three stages, with extended work areas similar to those of the previous stage (TMP 4,5&6) The final stage of works will be the reinstatement of the kerb and channel as well as road resurfacing. These will take place under a combination of the attached TMP?s
Night Works Night works will be implemented for the resurfacing of the road surface. A one way system restricting the eastbound traffic will be implemented from 6pm until approx. 11pm. (TMP 7 & 8) After the final westbound bus has passed through, a full road closure will be implemented until 5:30am, at which point the carriage way wil be returned to two way traffic. tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#10585 - Shirley Manhole Decommissioning
tns:item.tns:address: Various locations within the Shirley suburb
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin on the eastern side of Shirley (Sutton Place Cheam St, Mundys Ave) using generic plans and move westward on the LV/L1 roads, until reaching Hope St, at which point works will commence on L2 roads. (TMP 1) Due to narrow carriage ways, several locations will require site specific TMPs. (TMP 2, 3, 4) All works will require the excavation of 400mm from road level, then the redundant manholes will be then filled with appropriate materials, and then built up to road surface level, and sealed. Works may take up to 3 days. This will be dependent on the depth and width of the manhole and also on the availability of the appropriate backfill material.

tns:item.tns:title: SCIRT Waste Water Relay and Road Reconstructi
tns:item.tns:address: Aranui Catchment: Breezes Rd, Shortland St, Lenton St, Tomrich St, Rowses Rd, Merrington Cres, Betty Pl, Doreen St, Guernsey St, St Helliers Cres, Woodlands Pl, Carteret Pl and Marlow Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Installation of a new vacuum sewer system in parallel to keeping the existing system in operation. This involves installation of collection Chambers ? in council land, vent stacks on private boundaries and the install of new vacuum mains. Final hook up to the new system will happen only when the vacuum pump station is built and commissioned. The pump station is due for completion in Early 2016 and is being done by other parties outside this contract.
Due to the ground conditions and high water table this area went through a rigorous design process comparing it to Pressure WW and Vacuum WW. Road Reconstruction will then take place through out the whole catchment using the same setups and Road Closures

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ11115 - Ferry Rd Brick Barrel SW
tns:item.tns:address: Ferry Rd between Ryan St and #537 Ferry Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin at the intersection pedestrian crossing east of the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. The raised island on the north side of the crossing will be removed so that two-way traffic can safely be maintained while the repair works are carried out. Works will be carried out under a contra flow, with MTC as a contingency at night if the work area needs to be increased. Pedestrians will be directed to the pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Smith St. Once the island has been removed, temporary pavement will be laid up to level with the existing road. (TMP 1, SC Generics) Construction works are in the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. Two-way traffic will be maintained along with a north bound one way system on Hopkins St. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. Throughout works pedestrians will be redirected to alternate crossing at Ferry Rd/ Smith St. As these works are in close proximity to a school, a contingency plan for MTC before and after school hours may be implemented to facilitate the safe travel of children to and from school. (TMP 2, 2a,3,SC Generics) Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island, and reopening of the pedestrian crossing (TMP1, SC Generics) This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete. The next repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Isabella St. The first stage of these works will be the removal of a 20m section of the raised island separating east and west bound traffic. A centre of road closure with TSL will be implemented and removal works will take place at night, with partial closure of the east bound right turning lane on Ferry Rd. Due to the location of works, the removal of this section of the island is required so that west bound traffic can be directed in to the east bound right turning lane, as the east lane bound lane will be too narrow due to the work area. (TMP 4a, 4b) Due to the close proximity of works to the Ensors Rd intersection, a shorter taper and longitudinal safety zone will need to be installed. Water fill barriers will be used to reduce the risk of traffic entering the work area. Site access will require vehicles to enter at the sign posted site access point and reverse in to work area. The bus stop at the intersection of Ferry/Isabella will be relocated approx.150m west on Ferry Rd for the duration of works. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 5a,5b) Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island. (TMP 4a, 4b) This section repair is expected to take 40 days to complete. Upon completion of this section repair, works will shutdown for the holiday period, and resume on the 4th of January at the following location The final repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Manning Place. A contra flow with TSL and road closure of Manning Pl with east bound detour will be implemented for the duration of these works. Existing bus stops on the north and south sides of Ferry Rd will both be relocated 100m east on their respective sides. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 6a,6b,7) This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete.

tns:item.tns:title: SCIRT 11187 St Albans & Edgeware (WW)
tns:item.tns:address: Abberley Crescent Albany Street Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Coles Place Cornwall Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Geraldine Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Lindsay Street McDougall Avenue Madras Street Manchester Street Mansfield Avenue Murray Place Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
LOCATION: Abberley Crescent Albany Street Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Coles Place Cornwall Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Geraldine Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Lindsay Street McDougall Avenue Madras Street Manchester Street Mansfield Avenue Murray Place Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street
OPERATION: CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware and St Albans Catchments
The gravity wastewater main is the pipe that takes wastewater from private laterals through to the pump station. The existing gravity wastewater pipe has suffered multiple breaks due to the earthquakes and needs to be replaced. To complete the gravity wastewater renewal we need to dig trenches ranging from 1.1-2.5 metres deep. Dewatering, using spears and extraction pumping, will be required to drop the water table in the trenches at all times. Excavation will proceed once the ground is dry, using trench shields. A new PVC (polyvinyl chloride) pipe will be installed, then laterals will be renewed and attached at the private property boundary. There may need to be some excavation done at your boundary.
After replacement of the waste water pipe the carriageway will be reinstated and sealed, road markings will be applied if applicable.
Please note: CCTV and flushing of lines will be required prior to commencement of main works
TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT: Road closures with detours Priority / Give Way Manual Traffic Control One Way systems Contraflows etc?
COMMUNICATION: For further information please contact the Fletcher Construction Company - 0800 444 919

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11179 -Central City?SW,WW Repair & Lining
tns:item.tns:address: Various roads within the central city
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Works under generic plans Storm and waste water repairs. Spot Repairs Multiple spot repairs area required. The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged spot removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Spot repairs will require up to three days to complete. Section Repairs Multiple section repairs are required The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged section removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Section repairs will require up to 10 days to complete,
Lining Once all spot and section repairs are completed, these mains will then need to be lined. Lining will take place mostly during day time hours between 7am and 5pm or restricted to 9am to 4pm on the higher capacity roads. Lining works will generally require closures over two manholes, one of which is likely to be in the middle of an intersection. TTM for lining works will be deployed and removed daily as needed. Lining contractors may complete up to 3 lines per day, so up to 3 different closures a day may be required
Works under site specific plans Site specific plans will be added to the TMP as investigation works progress. It is assumed all works carried out under generic plans will not reduce capacity, and that site specific plans will be provided in most other cases as they are identified. These works will also be updated to the FWV when they are submitted for approval. Durations for any site specific plans will be similar those prescribed above.
Note: Any planned generic one way systems will be communicated to CTOC, Signals and ECAN a week before commencement.

tns:item.tns:title: Russley / Harewood Cycle Underpass
tns:item.tns:address: Russley Rd (SH1) / Harewood Rd, Harewood, Christchurch
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Splitter Islands will be established on the new roundabout layout using cones or sticky post delineation.
Temporary line marking is to be conducted to establish the roundabout.
VMS boards will be established prior to works to notify the traffic of the proposed layout change.
A temporary speed limit of 50kph will be in place and TL-2 Water Filled Barrier system will be in place to construct the centre section of the Harewood Rd / Russley Rd roundabout Cycle under Pass, the operation will be conducted during day work hours (0900 ? 1600).
Access to the work site within the roundabout will be controlled by spotters and any vehicles entering the roundabout will be shadowed by a TMA vehicle, Vehicle access / egress will limited to off peak periods.
Site personal access will also be maintained through the already constructed culvert.
Pedestrian provision will be provided while the works are being conducted.
This TMP will be tied into the current surrounding TMP?s as required

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11241 Woolston WW Infrastructure
tns:item.tns:address: Thistledown Place Lomond place St Lukes St
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
Thistledown Pl Quadraplex 11/01/2016 ? 01/04/2016 These works will be in the cul-de-sac of Thistledown Pl. Road closure will be deployed for any major construction movements and open trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main.. The work site will be reduced to a shoulder closure or lane width reduction wherever possible. The eastern footpath that leads into reserve will be blocked for these works, with pedestrians being directed to the western footpath. (TMP 1) Lomond Pl Lift station 18/01/2016 ? 01/04/2016 These works will be on the southern kerb close to the cul-de-sac of Lomond Pl . Road closure with a priority give way on Clydesdale St will be deployed for any major construction movements and open trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main.. The work site will be reduced to a priority give way or contra flow wherever possible. The southern footpath will be closed for the duration of works. (TMP 2&3)
St Lukes St Lift Station 18/01/2016 ? 20/03/2016 These works will be between #32 and #42 St Lukes St. A one way system will be established for the duration of works. Direction of one way system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works will be completed before works on the quadraplex begin. (TMP 4) St Lukes St Quadraplex 21/03/2016 ? 30/06/2016 These works will be east of the corner of St Johns St and St Lukes St outside #108. A one way system will be established for the duration of works. Direction of one way system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works will be commence once the lift station in TMP 4 is completed. Footpath on the northern kern will be closed for the duration of works ( TMP 5) All works will involve investigation of the construction area to identify underground services. These areas will then be excavated. In the case of the lift stations, sheet piling may be installed. Construction of the structures will be carried out under an appropriate TMP, and upon completion, all excavations in the carriage way will be backfilled reinstated and resurfaced. Any affected kerb, channel, footpaths and berms will also be reinstated and TTM will be removed.

tns:item.tns:address: Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Madras Street Manchester Street Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street
tns:item.tns:publicDescription:
LOCATION: Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Madras Street Manchester Street Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street
OPERATION: CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware, St Albans & Strowan Catchments
Storm Water -New pipe relay across and longitudinally to carriageway and footpath. -Localised dig down repairs in the carriageway and footpath. -CCTV pipe investigation from man holes and kerb side sumps. -Flushing and cleaning of pipes from manholes and kerb side sumps. -Pipe Lining and pipe patching installation from manholes and kerb side sumps.
Roading -Full road rebuilds including carriageway to a depth of 500mm, kerb, berm and footpath. -Minor shoulder repairs to carriageway, kerb, berm and footpath. -RAMM repairs including localised carriageway, kerb, berm and footpath repairs. -Minor repairs to the Bishop St Culvert wing walls
TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT: Road closures with detours Priority / Give Way Manual Traffic Control One Way systems Contraflows etc?
COMMUNICATION: For further information please contact the Fletcher Construction Company - 0800 444 919
